nodes.bodyText:
My naive reaction to this is "250% of what?" - I don't think most users will understand the exact effect here
It is perhaps a difficult idea to express but I'd like the warning to work for a user that has no idea what's going on.
Unrelated, I think the phrasing should begin something like "Rescheduling will also reset the ease ..." because it's a side effect that comes as a package deal, if I understand correctly, not as something separate from what the user is trying to do?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -74,6 +74,7 @@
         <item quantity="other">%d cards rescheduled</item>
     </plurals>
     <string name="reschedule_card_dialog_new_card_warning">Rescheduling will turn new cards into review cards. Use the ‘reposition card’ option to change a new card\'s position within the new queue</string>
+    <string name="reschedule_card_dialog_warning_ease_reset">Rescheduling will reset the ease of the card to %d%%</string>

nodes.bodyText: Rescheduling will also reset all factors used in the spaced repetition algorithm (ease will be set to 250%) ?

nodes.bodyText:
This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                <string name="reschedule_card_dialog_new_card_warning">Rescheduling will turn new cards into review cards. Use the ‘reposition card’ option to change a new card\'s position within the new queue</string>
          
          
            
                <string name="reschedule_card_dialog_new_card_warning">A new card is being rescheduled. Rescheduling also turns new cards into review cards. Use the ‘reposition card’ option to change a new card\'s position within the new queue</string>
          
      
    
    
  

I like this, I just want to add the idea of why the warning showed up (we detect a new card is being processed) and the idea that it is in addition to the requested action

nodes.bodyText:
This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                <string name="reschedule_card_dialog_warning_ease_reset">Rescheduling will also reset all factors used in the spaced repetition algorithm (ease will be set to %d%%)</string>
          
          
            
                <string name="reschedule_card_dialog_warning_ease_reset">Rescheduling also resets how the scheduler treats the card in the future (ease will be set to %d%%)</string>
          
      
    
    
  

I think that was a vast improvement! I took one more round because normal humans don't like the words "factor" and "algorithm" ;-)

nodes.bodyText:
Then most French columnist are not normal human, given how often "algorithm" is the cause of all problems of the modern world.
On second thought, I'm not sure that's actually a wrong conclusion
